text: <@U11HH3P7Y> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/5125/>
<@U13TWBRBL> <@U0PB67X4K> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/5127/> let's talk about which versions we will support
we currently have 4.5.x and greater... I think that this is only going to give us potential headaches
we won't have tested every version
so my recommendation would be to go exclusively with 6.9.x and greater as that is LTS and more current
I would NOT worry about what this or that dev uses
if they need, they can use nvm
thoughts?

<@U0KM61BCP> I know that wasn't aimed at me, but I'd agree with you. Most people will be on at least 6.x LTS anyway and considering that node look to be releasing a new LTS ~october, there isn't much point in supporting 7.x if it's going to cause hassle/delays
I came from 7.x before working with `fabric-sdk-node` and it really wasn't that hard to re-install node/npm with nvm.
<@U2W7U5UA3> agree
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U2W7U5UA3> yes I agree with that
can you please update the doc then (CR above) and change the packages.json?

so we should update the version range to 
```
“engines:” {
   “node”: ">= 6.9.0 <7.0”,
   “npm”: “>=2.15.9”
}
```
5127 updated
<@U13TWBRBL> thanks for the fix. Now I see end-to-end tests are passing on latest commits <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/sandbox/job/FIT-node-x86_64/2/console>

<@U0KM61BCP> also per above:

<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/5131/> (v1.0-alpha)
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/5133/> (master)
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/5133/> seems to need a lick unless CI is broken... <@U11HH3P7Y> or <@U0UHG4VP1>?
<@U0KM61BCP>: re-triggered 5133 and it's passed now..
thanks <@U11HH3P7Y>
merged <@U13TWBRBL> thanks
With levels as of a couple hours ago, gulp test and gulp test-headless run successfully, EXCEPT they seem to hang for a couple minutes after printing the coverage summary.  Anyone else notice this?
